bootupJs.name: JavaScript Boot-up Time
bootupJs.description: The amount of CPU time each script consumes per page. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/bootup-time/).

speedIndex.name: Speed Index
speedIndex.description: How quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated. This metric comes from [WebPageTest](https://github.com/WPO-Foundation/webpagetest-docs/blob/main/src/metrics/SpeedIndex.md) and differs slightly from the [Lighthouse version](https://web.dev/speed-index/) (which was based on this).

bytesCss.name: CSS Bytes
bytesCss.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all external stylesheets requested by the page. An external stylesheets is identified as a resource with the `css` file extension or a MIME type containing `css`.

bytesFont.name: Font Bytes
bytesFont.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all fonts requested by the page. A font is identified as a resource with the `eot`, `ttf`, `woff`, `woff2`, or `otf` file extensions or a MIME type containing `font`.

bytesHtml.name: HTML Bytes
bytesHtml.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all HTML documents requested by the page. An HTML document is identified as a resource with the `html` or `html` file extensions or a MIME type containing `html`.

bytesImg.name: Image Bytes
bytesImg.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all external images requested by the page. An external image is identified as a resource with the `png`, `gif`, `jpg`, `jpeg`, `webp`, `ico`, or `svg` file extensions or a MIME type containing `image`.

bytesJs.name: JavaScript Bytes
bytesJs.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all external scripts requested by the page. An external script is identified as a resource with the `js` or `json` file extensions or a MIME type containing `script` or `json`.

bytesOther.name: Other Bytes
bytesOther.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all unidentified resources requested by the page. An unidentified resource is one that does not match a known script, font, image, stylesheet, XML file, video, HTML document, or plaintext file.

bytesTotal.name: Total Kilobytes
bytesTotal.description: The sum of [transfer size](https://www.w3.org/TR/resource-timing-2/#dom-performanceresourcetiming-transfersize) kilobytes of all resources requested by the page.

bytesVideo.name: Video Bytes
bytesVideo.description: The sum of transfer size kilobytes of all videos requested by the page. A video is identified as a resource with the `mp4`, `swf`, `f4v`, or `flv` file extensions or a MIME type containing `flash`.

canonical.name: rel=canonical
canonical.description: The percent of pages with a valid canonical link. Canonical pages are detected by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/canonical/).

compileJs.name: JS Compile Time
compileJs.description: The number of milliseconds spent compiling each JavaScript resource.

dcl.name: DOMContentLoaded
dcl.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the initial HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed. See the [DOMContentLoaded event on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/DOMContentLoaded) for more info.

evalJs.name: JS Evaluation Time
evalJs.description: The number of milliseconds spent evaluating each JavaScript resource.

fcp.name: First Contentful Paint
fcp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the page's primary content appears on the screen.

hreflang.name: hreflang
hreflang.description: The percent of pages with a valid `hreflang` attribute, which allows crawlers to discover alternate translations of the page content. Validity is measured by Lighthouse.

fontDisplay.name: Font Display
fontDisplay.description: The percent of pages that avoid the flash of invisible text (FOIT) during web font loading by using the `font-display` CSS property. This metric is measured by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/font-display/).

legible.name: Legible Text
legible.description: The percent of pages with legible text. Legibility is measured by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/font-size/).

linkText.name: Descriptive Link Text
linkText.description: The percent of pages with descriptive link text. Descriptiveness is measured by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/link-text/).

ol.name: onLoad
ol.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the document and all of its dependent resources have finished loading. See the [load event on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Events/load) for more info.

numUrls.name: Sample Size
numUrls.description: The number of URLs analyzed in this report.

pctHttps.name: HTTPS Requests
pctHttps.description: The percent of all requests in the crawl whose URLs are prefixed with `https`.

pctVuln.name: Pages with Vulnerable JS
pctVuln.description: The percent of crawled pages that contain at least one known third-party JavaScript vulnerability. Vulnerabilities are detected by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/no-vulnerable-libraries/) using data from [Snyk](https://snyk.io/vuln?packageManager=all).

tcp.name: TCP Connections Per Page
tcp.description: The number of TCP connections per page.

h2.name: HTTP/2 Requests
h2.description: The percent of all requests in the crawl using HTTP/2. Note that servers supporting HTTP/2 and HTTP/3 may use HTTP/2 initially due to the way the HTTP Archive starts with a fresh Chrome instance each time, but may use HTTP/3 on subsequent requests.

h3.name: HTTP/3 Support
h3.description: The percent of all requests in the crawl which support HTTP/3. Note that, due to the way the HTTP Archive starts with a fresh Chrome instance each time, HTTP/3 will often not be used for initial connections until the browser is aware the server supports HTTP/3, which is why we measure support, rather than actual usage like we do for HTTP/2.

ttci.name: Time to Interactive
ttci.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the CPU had at least 5 seconds of quiescence. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/interactive/). [Read more about First Interactive and First Consistently Interactive](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GGiI9-7KeY3TPqS3YT271upUVimo-XiL5mwWorDUD4c/edit#heading=h.iqlwzaf6lqrh).

reqCss.name: CSS Requests
reqCss.description: The number of external stylesheets requested by the page. An external stylesheets is identified as a resource with the `css` file extension or a MIME type containing `css`.

offscreenImages.name: Offscreen Image Savings
offscreenImages.description: The number of kilobytes that could be saved per page by lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/offscreen-images/).

optimizedImages.name: Optimized Image Savings
optimizedImages.description: The number of kilobytes that could be saved per page by setting JPEG compression levels to 85 or lower. This metric comes from [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/uses-optimized-images/).

imgLazy.name: Native Image Lazy Loading
imgLazy.description: The percent of pages that have the `loading=lazy` attribute on `img` elements.

reqFont.name: Font Requests
reqFont.description: The number of fonts requested by the page. A font is identified as a resource with the `eot`, `ttf`, `woff`, `woff2`, or `otf` file extensions or a MIME type containing `font`.

reqHtml.name: HTML Requests
reqHtml.description: The number of HTML documents requested by the page. An HTML document is identified as a resource with the `html` or `html` file extensions or a MIME type containing `html`.

reqImg.name: Image Requests
reqImg.description: The number of external images requested by the page. An external image is identified as a resource with the `png`, `gif`, `jpg`, `jpeg`, `webp`, `ico`, or `svg` file extensions or a MIME type containing `image`.

reqJs.name: JavaScript Requests
reqJs.description: The number of external scripts requested by the page. An external script is identified as a resource with the `js` or `json` file extensions or a MIME type containing `script` or `json`.

reqOther.name: Other Requests
reqOther.description: The number of all unidentified resources requested by the page. An unidentified resource is one that does not match a known script, font, image, stylesheet, XML file, video, HTML document, or plaintext file.

reqTotal.name: Total Requests
reqTotal.description: The number of resources requested by the page.

reqVideo.name: Video Requests
reqVideo.description: The number of videos requested by the page. A video is identified as a resource with the `mp4`, `swf`, `f4v`, or `flv` file extensions or a MIME type containing `flash`.

cruxFp.name: First Paint
cruxFp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders. See the [Paint Timing API](https://w3c.github.io/paint-timing/#first-paint) for more info.

cruxLcp.name: Largest Contentful Paint
cruxLcp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders the largest image or text block visible within the viewport. See the [LargestContentfulPaint API](https://wicg.github.io/largest-contentful-paint/) for more info.

cruxCls.name: Cumulative Layout Shift
cruxCls.description: The layout shift scores for every unexpected layout shift that occurs during the entire lifespan of the page. See the [Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS)](https://web.dev/cls/) for more info.

cruxFcp.name: First Contentful Paint
cruxFcp.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders. See the [Paint Timing API](https://w3c.github.io/paint-timing/#first-paint) for more info.

cruxDcl.name: DOMContentLoaded
cruxDcl.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the browser first renders any text or graphics.

cruxOl.name: Onload
cruxOl.description: The number of seconds from the time the navigation started until the document and all of its dependent resources have finished loading.

cruxFid.name: First Input Delay
cruxFid.description: The number of milliseconds from the time the user initiates their first interaction to the time the page responds. See [FID in CrUX](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/first-input-delay-in-crux).

cruxInp.name: Interaction to Next Paint
cruxInp.description: The number of milliseconds from the time the user initiates an interaction to the time the page responds. See [Interaction to Next Paint (INP)](https://web.dev/inp/).

cruxTtfb.name: Time to First Byte
cruxTtfb.description: The number of milliseconds from the time the user initiates a navigation until the first bytes are received. See [Time to First Byte (TTFB)](https://web.dev/ttfb/).

cruxPassesCWV.name: Passes Core Web Vitals
cruxPassesCWV.description: The percentage of origins passing all three [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/#core-web-vitals) (LCP, FID, CLS) with a "good" experience. Note that if an origin is missing FID data, it's assessed based on the performance of the remaining metrics.

cruxFastFcp.name: Good First Contentful Paint
cruxFastFcp.description: The percentage of origins with "good" FCP experiences, less than or equal to 1.8 seconds.

cruxFastFp.name: Good First Paint
cruxFastFp.description: The percentage of origins with "good" FP experiences, less than or equal to 1 second.

cruxFastDcl.name: Good DOM Content Loaded
cruxFastDcl.description: The percentage of origins with "good" DCL experiences, less than or equal to 1 second.

cruxFastOl.name: Good Onload
cruxFastOl.description: The percentage of origins with "good" OL experiences, less than or equal to 1 second.

cruxFastFid.name: Good First Input Delay
cruxFastFid.description: The percentage of origins with "good" FID experiences, less than or equal to 100 ms. See [FID in CrUX](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/first-input-delay-in-crux).

cruxFastInp.name: Good Interaction to Next Paint
cruxFastInp.description: The percentage of origins with "good" INP experiences, less than or equal to 200 ms. See [Interaction to Next Paint (INP)](https://web.dev/inp/).

cruxFastLcp.name: Good Largest Contentful Paint
cruxFastLcp.description: The percentage of origins with "good" LCP experiences, less than or equal to 2.5 seconds.

cruxFastTtfb.name: Good Time to First Byte
cruxFastTtfb.description: The percentage of origins with "good" TTFB experiences, less than or equal to 800ms. See [Time to First Byte (TTFB)](https://web.dev/ttfb/).

cruxLargeCls.name: Poor Cumulative Layout Shift
cruxLargeCls.description: The percentage of origins with "poor" CLS experiences, greater than 0.25.

cruxSlowFcp.name: Poor First Contentful Paint
cruxSlowFcp.description: The percentage of origins with "poor" FCP experiences, greater than 3 seconds.

cruxSlowFid.name: Poor First Input Delay
cruxSlowFid.description: The percentage of origins with "poor" FID experiences, greater than 250 ms. See [FID in CrUX](https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/07/first-input-delay-in-crux).

cruxSlowInp.name: Poor Interaction to Next Paint
cruxSlowInp.description: The percentage of origins with "poor" INP experiences, greater than 500 ms. See [Interaction to Next Paint (INP)](https://web.dev/inp/).

cruxSlowLcp.name: Poor Largest Contentful Paint
cruxSlowLcp.description: The percentage of origins with "poor" LCP experiences, greater than 4.0 seconds.

cruxSlowTtfb.name: Poor Time to First Byte
cruxSlowTtfb.description: The percentage of origins with "poor" TTFB experiences, greater than 1800ms. See [Time to First Byte (TTFB)](https://web.dev/ttfb/).

cruxSmallCls.name: Good Cumulative Layout Shift
cruxSmallCls.description: The percentage of origins with "good" CLS experiences, less and or equal to 0.1.

vulnJs.name: Vulnerable JavaScript Libraries Per Page
vulnJs.description: The number of known third-party JavaScript vulnerabilities per page. Vulnerabilities are detected by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/no-vulnerable-libraries/) using data from [Snyk](https://snyk.io/vuln?packageManager=all).

pwaScores.name: PWA Scores
pwaScores.description: This metric tracks the median [PWA score](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/v3/scoring#pwa) in [Lighthouse](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/). Lighthouse is popular automated tool for improving the quality of web pages.

swControlledPages.name: Service Worker Controlled Pages
swControlledPages.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that have triggered the ```ServiceWorkerControlledPage``` [use counter](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/public/mojom/web_feature/web_feature.mojom) that fires whenever a page is controlled by a service worker.

a11yScores.name: Accessibility Scores
a11yScores.description: This metric tracks the distribution of [Accessibility category scores in Lighthouse](https://web.dev/accessibility-scoring/).

a11yButtonName.name: Button Name
a11yButtonName.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse audit](https://web.dev/button-name/) that checks if buttons have an accessible name.

a11yColorContrast.name: Color Contrast
a11yColorContrast.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse color-contrast audit](https://web.dev/color-contrast/) that checks if pages background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.

a11yImageAlt.name: Image Alt
a11yImageAlt.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse image-alt audit](https://web.dev/image-alt/) that checks if all images have alternate text.

a11yLabel.name: Label
a11yLabel.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse label audit](https://web.dev/label/) that checks if all form elements have associated labels.

a11yLinkName.name: Link Name
a11yLinkName.description: The percent of pages that pass the [Lighthouse link-name audit](https://web.dev/link-name/) that checks if all links have discernable text.

asyncClipboardRead.name: Async Clipboard Read
asyncClipboardRead.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *read* data from the system clipboard via the [Async Clipboard API](https://web.dev/image-support-for-async-clipboard/).

badgeSet.name: Badge Set
badgeSet.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *set* a badge via the [Badging API](https://web.dev/badging-api/).

badgeClear.name: Badge Clear
badgeClear.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that *clear* a badge via the [Badging API](https://web.dev/badging-api/).

getInstalledRelatedApps.name: Get Installed Related Apps
getInstalledRelatedApps.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that get the installed related apps via the [Get Installed Related Apps API](https://web.dev/get-installed-related-apps/).

periodicBackgroundSync.name: Periodic Background Sync
periodicBackgroundSync.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that observe a `periodicsync` event that was registered via the [Periodic Background Sync API](https://web.dev/periodic-background-sync/).

periodicBackgroundSyncRegister.name: Periodic Background Sync Register
periodicBackgroundSyncRegister.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that register a `periodicsync` event via the [Periodic Background Sync API](https://web.dev/periodic-background-sync/).

storageEstimate.name: Storage Estimation
storageEstimate.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that estimate available storage via the [Storage API](https://web.dev/persistent-storage/).

storagePersist.name: Persistent Storage
storagePersist.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that ask for their data to be stored in persisted storage via the [Storage API](https://web.dev/persistent-storage/).

notificationTriggers.name: Notification Triggers
notificationTriggers.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that use scheduled notifications via the [Notification Triggers API](https://web.dev/notification-triggers/).

webSocketStream.name: WebSocketStream
webSocketStream.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that transmit messages via the [WebSocketStream API](https://web.dev/websocketstream/).

screenWakeLock.name: Screen Wake Lock
screenWakeLock.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that acquire a screen wake lock via the [Screen Wake Lock API](https://web.dev/wakelock/).

contentIndex.name: Content Indexing
contentIndex.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that add content to the content index via the [Content Indexing API](https://web.dev/content-indexing-api/).

quicTransport.name: QuicTransport
quicTransport.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that add transmit messages via the [QuicTransport API](https://web.dev/quictransport/).

idleDetection.name: Idle Detection
idleDetection.description: This metric tracks the percentage of pages that detect when the user is idle via the [Idle Detection API](https://web.dev/idle-detection/).

state-of-images.name: State of Images
state-of-images.summary: Images are the most popular resource type on the web. In this report we analyze how images are being used across the web.

state-of-javascript.name: State of JavaScript
state-of-javascript.summary: JavaScript powers the modern web, enabling rich and interactive web applications. In this report we dive into how JavaScript is used on the web, and its adoption and trends both for mobile and desktop experiences.

loading-speed.name: Loading Speed
loading-speed.summary: Web performance can directly impact business metrics like conversion and user happiness. This report analyzes various performance metrics in the lifecycle of a loading page including those used by many modern progressive web apps.

state-of-the-web.name: State of the Web
state-of-the-web.summary: This report captures a long view of the web, including the adoption of techniques for efficient network utilization and usage of web standards like HTTPS.

search-engine-optimization.name: SEO
search-engine-optimization.summary: How websites are built can affect their ranking in search results. This report tracks the adoption of several key Search Engine Optimization (SEO) techniques.

page-weight.name: Page Weight
page-weight.summary: This report tracks the size and quantity of many popular web page resources. Sizes represent the number of bytes sent over the network, which may be compressed.

chrome-ux-report.name: CrUX
chrome-ux-report.summary: Loading and interactivity performance as experienced by real-world Chrome users across a diverse set of hardware and network conditions, powered by the [Chrome User Experience Report](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-user-experience-report/).

progressive-web-apps.name: Progressive Web Apps
progressive-web-apps.summary: This report examines the state of [Progressive Web Apps (PWAs)](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/). PWAs are a new class of web applications, enabled by the [Service Worker APIs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/Service_Worker_API). Service workers allow apps to support network-independent loading, to receive push notifications as well as to synchronize data in the background, and — together with [Web App Manifests](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Manifest) — allow users to install PWAs.

accessibility.name: Accessibility
accessibility.summary: This report tracks accessibility of pages as measured by [Lighthouse](https://web.dev/lighthouse-accessibility/).

project-fugu.name: Capabilities
project-fugu.summary: The [Capabilities Project](https://web.dev/fugu-status/) (aka. Project Fugu 🐡) is a cross-company effort at Google to make it possible for web apps to do anything native apps can, by exposing the capabilities of the operating system platform to the web platform, while maintaining user security, privacy, trust, and other core tenets of the web.

cwv-tech.name: Core Web Vitals Technology Report
cwv-tech.summary: The Core Web Vitals Technology Report is a dashboard combining the powers of real-user experiences in the [Chrome User Experience Report (CrUX)](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-user-experience-report/) dataset with web technology detections available in HTTP Archive, to allow analysis of the way websites are both built and experienced.

cwv-tech-new.name: BETA: Core Web Vitals Technology Report
cwv-tech-new.summary: The Core Web Vitals Technology Report is a dashboard combining the powers of real-user experiences in the [Chrome User Experience Report (CrUX)](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-user-experience-report/) dataset with web technology detections available in HTTP Archive, to allow analysis of the way websites are both built and experienced.
